text: Big Bumba-meu-boi in the Paço Alfândega cultural center and mall, Recife Toada is a style of Central Amazonian folk music now moving into the mainstream in Brazil. It is a combination of traditional Amazonian rhythms with African and European influence. The genre was made known throughout Brazil after Amazonian group Carrapicho's hit "Tic Tic Tac". ==See also== * Bumba Meu Boi Category:Dance in Brazil Category:South American music
title: Boi (music)
